inclusion.criterion: Read and sign the consent form.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Male or female > 18 years of age
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Surgical diagnosis of severe necrotizing fasciitis, severe necrotizing skin and soft tissue infections (e.g. Fournier's gangrene)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: At least three of the following clinical signs and symptoms of local infection should be present: pain out of proportion to clinical findings, tenderness to palpation, swelling, erythema, induration, pus formation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Positive gram stain or wound culture obtained within 3 calendar days prior to the first dose of Daptomycin.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: If female, pregnant, or lactating and breast-feeding
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Previous antibiotic therapy exceeding 72 hours duration, unless patient is worsening clinically or has gram positive pathogens cultured from wound that are resistant to current antibiotic therapy.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 25-year-old pregnant woman with fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, urgency, frequency, and flank pain. She has no history of recurrent UTI or underlying disease.
